title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-6.5 - Conditional registration
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 80-6.5 - Conditional registration

State Regulations
(a) The department, in its discretion, may issue a conditional registration to a
CTLE certificate holder who attests to noncompliance with the CTLE requirements
of this section, provided that such CTLE certificate holder meets the following
requirements: (1)
the CTLE certificate holder
agrees to remedy such deficiency within the conditional registration period; and
(2)
the CTLE certificate holder
agrees to complete any additional CTLE during such conditional registration
period that the department may require. (b) The duration of a conditional
registration shall be determined by the department and shall not exceed one
year and shall not be renewed or extended absent good cause. (c) If a CTLE certificate holder does not
submit evidence, satisfactory to the department, of completion of the required
hours of CTLE within the duration of such conditional registration period, his/her registration shall be denied and the CTLE certificate holder shall not
be permitted to practice at an applicable school. If the CTLE certificate
holder continues to practice at an applicable school without his/her
registration, he/she shall be subject to moral character review pursuant to

Part 83 of this Title. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
80-6.5

Adopted

New

York State Register June 29, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 26, eff. 6/29/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
